data.title: Aircraft landing can be interrupted
data.body:
Discovered while testing #13861

Press stop when the aircraft is near ground level.

https://youtu.be/gubzUATl_m4

Helicopter landing/take off can be interrupted too, in that case, they stay in some altitude between cruise height and ground level, where is given the stop order.

data.title: Follow activity sometimes fail to Cancel()
data.body:
CancelActivity() or Cancel() doesn't work on Follow activity sometimes.
I think it has something to do with child/inner activity.
When fails, it gets stuck at WaitFor activity when seen through Show actor tags debug function.

I use follow activity for the slave miner. When the slave miner undeploys and gets going, slaves are assigned follow task. When the miner deploys, Follow is canceled for slaves and FindResources is newly assigned.

data.title: [RA] RevealOnDeath with Aircraft
data.body:
Taking advantage of #12999 this PR would add a short duration of vision with aircraft crashes.

Closes #13864 

One issue out of my reach is a small time-gap between the disappearance of the dying unit and its added RevealOnDeath vision. This makes the vision "flicker" when the trait is activated. This happen with any unit the trait is assigned to.

Also if there is a way of deactivating the trait on landed aircrafts that could eliminate the effect when the units are on ground. At least within the content of this PR it would be more consistent.

*edit: set 8c0 vision range to Transport.Husk as with the Transport unit itself. Overlooked by the previous balance PR

data.title: [RA] Additional tweak of the Artillery weapon
data.body:
Recommend adding this with the next playtest.

Additional tweaking of the Artillery weapon after testing and input by netnazgul:
http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=304144#304144

vs None: 90, up from 80
vs Wood: 40, up from 35

As always, no guarantees but the more input these values are based upon the better.

data.body: Fixes #13850, a regression due to the hitshapes change which was granting the sonic tank too high damage.

data.title: Add GrantConditionOnAmmo
Multiple WithMakeAnimation traits support
data.body:
#13822 allows skipping of transformations but that wasn't quite enough:

Demo: https://youtu.be/EFjW0aGE_xY
(The demo has a bug targeted by #13745, that horse shoe stops spinning after playing make animation)
That super radar dome has multiple WithSpriteBody to support the gap generator part and the dome part, each with a separate WIthMakeAnimation.

To support multiple bodies and multiple WithMakeAnimation traits we need a filter.

data.title: Add TransferAmmoWarhead
data.body:
This Warhead allows transferring ammo from one actor to another one and similar things. The change of AttackBase is needed to allow attacking without adding a DamageWarhead to the weapon. It shouldn't affect anything except the EMPulseCannon in TS and explosions in all bundled mods. The EMPulseCannon uses AttackOrderPower which uses AttackBase internally but shouldn't call into the modified part of it.

Skript:
```
#!/bin/bash

for mod in "ra" "cnc" "d2k" "ts"; do
        for line in $(egrep -r '^[a-zA-Z0-9]+:$' "mods/$mod/weapons/" | cut -d':' -f2); do
                mono OpenRA.Utility.exe "$mod" --resolved-weapons "$line" | grep "Warhead" | egrep "(HealthPercentageDamage|SpreadDamage|TargetDamage)" > /dev/null
                if [ "$?" == "1" ]; then
                        echo "No DamageWarhead found for weapon $line in mod $mod"
                fi
        done
done
```

Result:
```
No DamageWarhead found for weapon BuildingExplode in mod ra
No DamageWarhead found for weapon SmallBuildingExplode in mod ra
No DamageWarhead found for weapon BuildingExplode in mod cnc
No DamageWarhead found for weapon UnitExplodeSmall in mod d2k
No DamageWarhead found for weapon UnitExplodeMed in mod d2k
No DamageWarhead found for weapon UnitExplodeLarge in mod d2k
No DamageWarhead found for weapon BuildingExplode in mod d2k
No DamageWarhead found for weapon WallExplode in mod d2k
No DamageWarhead found for weapon EMPulseCannon in mod ts
No DamageWarhead found for weapon BuildingExplosions in mod ts
No DamageWarhead found for weapon CyborgExplode in mod ts
```

data.title: Chronosphere and Cargo/Transport conflict
data.body:
i played a mp game this day and something strange happened.
a teammate of mine selected an mcv of mine not knowing i was going to load it into a transport boat at the same time. I guess my teammate targetted the final destination only after my mcv was loaded. I fled to another place on the map, but after unloading in the timer of the chrono started ticking of, and after timing out it chrono'ed my mcv back to where i came from,,,,,,,,,,,,in the middle of all the danger,,,,,,,,,,,, -_-,,,,,,,,,,so i lost

but that doesnt mather,

i hope you guys can reproduce this bug

cheerzz,

Ohmk Torque

data.title: Replace some hardcoded Aircraft assumptions with bool fields
data.body:
This lays some groundwork for easier activity merging (Fly & HeliFly etc.) and easier hybrid behavior implementation.

Additionally removed single-use `FlyCircleTimed` activity.

data.title: Add RevealOnDeath traits to misc. units
data.body:
Taking advantage of #12999 the trait can aid in certain in-game situations where you'd want to have a peak at the aftermath of a unit kill, including aircraft crashes and nuke truck explosions. For units in general it could function as a visual aid to point out where a unit was lost. For the most part it would classify as a visual polish but in certain situations could have a few balance implications where the player gets an opportunity to spot the killer should it pass the revealed area.

following discussion on:
http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=304207#304207

If there's interest I'd love to pitch something simple before the next playtest.

data.title: System.Reflection.ReflectionTypeLoadException
data.body:
Today I open the game and then I found the game crash with a System.Reflection.ReflectionTypeLoadException , I found something on wiki said it means game require .NET Framework 4.5, but for develop reasons I have 4.5 and higher version (4.7) installed (include SDK), so I want to know what exactly happened.
One more thing, I just installed the RedAlert 2 mod, is this thing caused the exception?

data.title: Add units to Control Group with Shift
data.body:
_Shift + 0-9_ - Add units to group 0-9 (or create the group), currently it is _Ctrl + Shift + 0-9_.
See http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=20253 for comparison of release vs this PR.

data.title: Planes stop mid-air for a tick when the stop hotkey is pressed
data.body:
Repro case: build a Yak in RA and then spam <kbd>s</kbd>.

This is not new, but I'm not aware of any existing tickets for this.

data.title: Merge pull request #1 from OpenRA/bleed
data.body: Update

data.title: Add 64/32 bit OpenRA process check to sysinfo.
data.body:
#12610 tells us about the native OS, but we need to know about OpenRA itself if we want to understand the full picture.  Specifically, for #13478, it would be useful to know how many Linux players are already running OpenRA as 64 bit.  If it is a lot then we have already covered the testing aspect discussed there.

This also fixes a formatting issue that is causing mixed `1.00` vs `1,00` in the database.

data.title: Replace remaining SupportPower CameraActors with CameraRange
data.body: Using `RevealShroudEffect` like `NukePower` already does.

data.title: Rename EditorTilesetFilter to something more generic
data.body:
From IRC:
```
[17:17] <reaperrr> pchote: Would removing 'Tileset' from the trait name be enough ('EditorFilter'), or would 'EditorVisibility' be better?
[17:18] <+pchote> I would prefer something like MapEditorData
```

Possibly a candidate for stable, since it's an easy and obvious fix.

data.title: Grant a condition while performing an external capture
data.body:
Add a notifier for the beginning of an external capture
Implement uncloaking when a capture begins (#13767)

The attached replay demonstrate engineers modded with the cloaking trait that get uncloaked when they starts capturing an enemy building.
[OpenRA-2017-08-15T165036Z.orarep.zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/1225786/OpenRA-2017-08-15T165036Z.orarep.zip)

I'm not sure what will happen if the cloaked unit finish capturing the building.
Should it get cloaked again ? Does that happen automatically ? Could that happen while the unit is still capturing the building ?
